post_text: Today at Shore School - In order to learn about taking care of a place, about natural systems, about life cycles, weather patterns, and why we should be good stewards of nature, children must first get to know a specific area of nature deeply. They need to experience it in all seasons, weather, and temperature. Building on last year’s experiences at Forest School, first graders have visited the shorelines of Marine Park, Coney Island, and Prospect Park Lake. During Shore School, first graders spend time observing, sketching, and taking notes about what they notice. They spend time playing and exploring, digging, sorting, and discovering. After this time, the class comes together back at school to continue their learning in the classroom with read alouds, observational drawings of artifacts, and writing to reflect on what they noticed, share questions and explore wonderings. #educatingforsustainability #shoreschool #progressiveeducation #intentionallydiverseschool #science #systemsstudy #research #outdooreducation #natureplay #firstgrade #commons #compassyear6

post_text: Today the Pine Class (3rd Grade) celebrated the end of their first integrated unit, which asks the question "What role do cultures play in our lives?" Students shared what they learned about their class and family's culture through various projects, incorporating, cooking, artwork, singing, and dancing. Throughout this unit, students have interviewed family and community members to learn more about the cultures that have shaped them and shape others. They even wrote persuasive pieces to the co-leaders asking for more cultural representation in the school snack, libraries, and even at recess. #integratedcurriculum #educatingforsustainability #culture #culturestudy #socialactivism #socialstudies #writing #progressiveeducation #intentionallydiverseschool #compassyear6 @ Fort Greene, Brooklyn

post_text: 4th grade entrepreneurs are extending their understanding of place value, addition and subtraction as owners and drivers in a Puzzle Cube Packing Company! Multi-day investigations into how to pack puzzle cubes in boxes, how to load trucks, how to manage inventory, and how to calculate their profit give students multiple opportunities to explore additive structuring and expand their place value thinking into the millions. The inquiry-based context asks kids to notice patterns & develop theories, which their work is meant to prove. They are also able to connect their math learning to the real-world and this provides many opportunities for collaboration, creative problem-solving and teamwork! #fourthgrade #magnoliaclass #lindenclass #mathematicseducation #contextsforlearningmathematics #progressiveeducation #intentionallydiverseschool #compassyear6 @ Fort Greene, Brooklyn

This Friday, during Celebrate Compass' auction, you will have a chance to win a foursome at Knollwood Country Club in Elmsford, NY (Carts, Lunch, and Forecaddie included). Founded in 1894, Knollwood is one of the oldest golf courses in America and has been the site of several PGA tournaments including two US Opens. Golfing legend Ben Hogan used to stay in the guest house in the 1950’s whenever he visited New York. And it’s less than 30 minutes from midtown Manhattan.

Celebrate Compass' Auction Catalogue is full great prizes and experiences. Check out our comprehensive list of restaurant outings, overnight stays, art, tickets to fun events, and a number of unique experiences for you and your friends to enjoy. Many of the prizes are family friendly.

post_text:
Fort Greene Friends and Neighbors,

We are planning to hold a Climate Strike March on Friday the 15th at 2PM to honor the hard work of young people worldwide to draw attention to this issue. Our Compass Climate Strike March is being created to allow for developmentally appropriate participation for children of all ages. We are called to action to support this worldwide movement as it connects to our vision of educating for sustainability. Social Justice and the Environment are two of the three pillars of sustainability. After lunch and recess on Friday, we will invite our students and staff to join us in a march around the neighborhood. We plan to end in Fort Greene Park with a few songs that celebrate our commitment to taking care of the Earth. If you would like to join us, please meet us in front of our school at 2PM on Friday. We'd love to have you join us!

Talking to young children about climate change is tricky. The link below has some helpful tips.
https://www.yesmagazine.org/planet/talking-to-kids-climate-change-advice-20190307
